verses.text: In my affliction I cried to the Lord, and he listened to me.
Deliver my soul, O Lord, from unjust lips, and from a deceitful tongue.
What should be given to you, and what should be added to you, for \add your\add* crafty tongue?
Sharpened weapons of the mighty, with coals of the desert.
Woe is me, that my sojourning is \f + \fr 119:5 \fqa Heb. משך \f* prolonged; I have tabernacled among the tents of Kedar.
My soul has long been a sojourner;
I was peaceful among them that hated peace; when I spoke to them, they warred against me without a cause.
